IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDE FREE 24/7 EMOTIONAL SUPPORT FOR THOSE IN CRISIS
IRS990.MissionDesc: CRISIS TEXT LINE PROVIDES FREE, 24/7, HIGH-QUALITY TEXT-BASED MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT AND CRISIS INTERVENTION BY EMPOWERING A COMMUNITY OF TRAINED VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT PEOPLE IN THEIR MOMENTS OF NEED.
IRS990.Desc: CRISIS COUNSELOR COMMUNITY - ALL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH RECRUITING AND RETAINING VOLUNTEER'S DEVELOPMENT, TRAINING AND CULTURAL COMPETENCIES IN THE COMMUNITY TO APPROPRIATELY COMMUNICATE WITH AND PROMOTE CTL, INC. AS A SERVICE TO ALL COMMUNITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPERVISION - A DEDICATED GROUP OF PAID SUPERVISORS THAT SERVICE AND MANAGE CRISIS COUNSELORS AND OVERSEE ALL TEXTERS ON THE CTL, INC. PLATFORM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ENGINEERING & TECH - CODING, REFINING, AND SUPPORTING THE CTL, INC. TEXTING PLATFORM.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: DATA - A DEDICATED GROUP OF DATA SCIENTISTS THAT COLLECT AND SHARE STATISTICAL DATA AND DEVELOP METRICS FROM TEXTING ACTIVITY AND CRISIS COUNSELOR DEMOGRAPHICS. INTERNATIONAL EXPANSION - ALL COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH SETTING UP PARTNERSHIPS WITH ORGANIZATIONS OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES TO EXPAND TEXTING SERVICES GLOBALLY.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: ELENA COMMUNICATIONS LLC DBA JELENA GRO

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIUM
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS IN MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES
AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.TypeOfActivitiesConductedTxt: SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS IN MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS
SUPPORT FOR INDIVIDUALS IN MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS

GrantsToOrgOutsideUSGrp.RegionTxt: NORTH AMERICA - CANADA AND MEXICO, BUT NOT THE UNITED STATES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AROUND THE WORLD TO FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION TO USE TECHNOLOGY AND DATA INNOVATIONS TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS SUFFERING MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS.
REFER TO FORM 990 PART VII FOR DETAILS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD AS WELL AS BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR FINANCIAL AND AUDIT MATTERS PRIOR TO FILING. THE FINAL FORM 990 (FILED WITH THE IRS) WILL BE AVAILABLE AT THE NEXT MEETING OF THE BOARD FOR INSPECTION. IN ADDITION, UPON REQUEST OF ANY BOARD MEMBER, A COPY WILL BE PROVIDED. IF THERE ARE ANY MATERIAL CHANGES, AN AMENDED FORM 990 WILL BE FILED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ENFORCES THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY MONITORING KNOWN RELATIONSHIPS, QUESTIONNAIRES THAT INCLUDE INQUIRIES OF ANY NEW RELATIONSHIPS, AND NOTING ANY CHANGES IN DISCLOSED INFORMATION. IF THERE ARE ANY CONFLICTS , CIRCUMSTANCES ARE REVIEWED BY THE COMPANY GENERAL COUNSEL AND THE BOARD BEFORE A DECISION FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPANY'S HEAD OF HUMAN CAPITAL WORKS WITH AN OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRM TO MONITOR AND CONDUCT COMPENSATION REVIEWS AS WELL AS MEET ON AN ANNUAL BASIS WITH THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. IN ADDITION, PERIODIC REVIEWS OF CURRENT PUBLISHED DATA FROM KNOWN WEBSITES, INCLUDING GUIDESTAR, CHARITY NAVIGATOR, AND NY NON-PROFIT NETWORK ANNUAL SALARY SURVEY, ARE PERFORMED TO GATHER STATISTICAL DATA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

THE ADDRESS AND TELEPHONE NUMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION CHANGED. THIS CHANGED PART B AND PART IV SECTION C, LINE 20. THE AMOUNTS REPORTED FOR PAID OFFICERS AND THE HIGHEST PAID EMPLOYEES WERE ERRONEOUSLY STATED ON THE ORIGINAL 990 DUE TO AN UNINTENTIONAL ERROR. THE ERROR AFFECTED PART IX LINES 5, 7-9, PART VII, LINES D+F AS WELL AS SCHEDULE J, PARTII, COLUMNS B(I), C, D AND E. IN ADDITION, PART V, LINE 1C WAS ERRONEOUSLY NOT MARKED AS YES ON THE ORIGINAL 990. THE SPECIFIC DIFFERENCES ARE AS FOLLOWS: 990, PART VII DENA TRUJILLO: COLUMN D INCREASED 53,537, COLUMN F DECREASED (36,274) LAWRENCE BROOKS: COLUMN D INCREASED 33,976, COLUMN F DECREASED (36,739) SHAIRI TURNER-DAVIS: COLUMN D INCREASED 43,163, COLUMN F DECREASED (5,922) BENJAMIN KOLIN: COLUMN D NO CHANGE, COLUMN F DECREASED (19,956) ROBERT FILBIN: COLUMN D NO CHANGE, COLUMN F DECREASED (10,203) DANA TRADER: COLUMN D INCREASED 33,943, COLUMN F DECREASED (36,919) MISHKA PITTERARMAND: COLUMN D INCREASED 37,122, COLUMN F DECREASED (23,432) PART IX LINE 5 OFFICER WAGES: COLUMN A DECREASED (77,392), COLUMN B DECREASED (23,669), COLUMN C DECREASED (134,972), COLUMN D DECREASED 81,249 LINE 7 OTHER WAGES: COLUMN A INCREASED 77,392, COLUMN B INCREASED 23,669, COLUMN C INCREASED 134,972, COLUMN D INCREASED (81,249) LINE 8 PENSION: COLUMN A INCREASED 1,266, COLUMN B INCREASED 188, COLUMN C INCREASED 1,051, COLUMN D INCREASED 27 LINE 9 OTHER EMPLOYEE BENEFITS: COLUMN A DECREASED (1,266), COLUMN B DECREASED (188), COLUMN C DECREASED (1,051), COLUMN D DECREASED (27) 990, SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN B(I), C, D AND E DENA TRUJILLO: B (I) INCREASED 53,537, C DECREASED (401), D DECREASED (35,873), E INCREASED 17,263 LAWRENCE BROOKS: B (I) INCREASED 33,976, C DECREASED (866), D DECREASED (35,873), E DECREASED (2,763) SHAIRI TURNER-DAVIS: B (I) INCREASED 43,163, C DECREASED (392), D DECREASED (5,530), E INCREASED 37,241 BENJAMIN KOLIN: B (I) NO CHANGE, C DECREASED (1,212), D DECREASED (18,744), E DECREASED (19,956) ROBERT FILBIN: B (I) NO CHANGE, C DECREASED (755), D DECREASED (9,448), E DECREASED (10,203) DANA TRADER: B (I) INCREASED 33,943, C DECREASED (713), D DECREASED (36,206), E DECREASED (2,976) MISHKA PITTERARMAND: B (I) INCREASED 37,122, C NO CHANGE, D DECREASED (23,432), E DECREASED 13,690
